text: Richard Green Lugar (April 4, 1932 â€“ April 28, 2019) was an American politician. He served as a United States Senator from Indiana from 1977 to 2013. He was on the Foreign Relations Committee. Before becoming a Senator, he was mayor of Indianapolis. Lugar ran for an eighth term in 2012, but lost the Republican primary on May 8, 2012 to Richard Mourdock. Lugar ran for President of the United States in 1996 but lost the Republican nomination to Bob Dole. Lugar died on April 28, 2019 in Falls Church, Virginia, from problems caused by chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy. He was 87. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:American mayors Category:Deaths from neurodegenerative disease Category:American Methodists Category:1996 United States presidential candidates Category:Disease-related deaths in Virginia Category:United States senators from Indiana Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Richard Lugar
